shorts.title: LOCAL COLLEGE: Lady Royals roll in Landmark opener
shorts.title_distilled: LOCAL COLLEGE: Lady Royals roll in Landmark opener.
shorts.description: Holy Cross graduate Kaci Kranson, Elizabeth Bennett and Meghan Lamanna each scored 15 points to lead the University of Scranton women’s basketball team to a 71-48 victory over Drew in the Landmark Conference opener for both teams Wednesday at Baldwin Gym in Madison, N.J. Katie Gorski added 12 points and 10 rebounds for the Lady Royals, who played their first game since upsetting Division I Pittsburgh, 69-63, on Sunday. Alice Altomare led Drew with 15 points. Scranton faces Goucher on Saturday at 4 p.m. in its home opener. Men’s basketball Valley View graduate Eli Yusavage scored 27 points to lead […]
shorts.content: Holy Cross graduate Kaci Kranson, Elizabeth Bennett and Meghan Lamanna each scored 15 points to lead the University of Scranton women’s basketball team to a 71-48 victory over Drew in the Landmark Conference opener for both teams Wednesday at Baldwin Gym in Madison, N.J. Katie Gorski added 12 points and 10 rebounds for the Lady Royals, who played their first game since upsetting Division I Pittsburgh, 69-63, on Sunday. Alice Altomare led Drew with 15 points. Scranton faces Goucher on Saturday at 4 p.m. in its home opener. Men’s basketball Valley View graduate Eli Yusavage scored 27 points to lead […]

shorts.title: Memorial plaque presented to Olyphant Vietnam veteran’s wife
shorts.title_distilled: Memorial plaque presented to Olyphant Vietnam veteran’s wife.
shorts.description: Army veteran Vincent Narcoonis of Olyphant, who died on May 10 at the age of 76, was a recipient of two Purple Hearts and other service medals while serving in the Vietnam War. Commander Peter Puhalla Sr. of the Shopa Davey VFW Post 6082, Peckville, presented a memorial plaque of all of Vincent Narcoonis’ medals to his wife, Joan Narcoonis, this month.
shorts.content: Army veteran Vincent Narcoonis of Olyphant, who died on May 10 at the age of 76, was a recipient of two Purple Hearts and other service medals while serving in the Vietnam War. Commander Peter Puhalla Sr. of the Shopa Davey VFW Post 6082, Peckville, presented a memorial plaque of all of Vincent Narcoonis’ medals to his wife, Joan Narcoonis, this month.
shorts.content_distilled: Army veteran Vincent Narcoonis of Olyphant, who died on May 10 at the age of 76, was a recipient of two Purple Hearts and other service medals while serving in the Vietnam War.
